content:
DesignerActionItemCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of DesignerActionItem objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public class DesignerActionItemCollection : System.Collections.CollectionBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.CollectionBase
  • DesignerActionItemCollection

Constructors

  • DesignerActionItemCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the DesignerActionItemCollection class.

    public DesignerActionItemCollection ();

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to create a DesignerActionItemCollection and populate it to form a smart tag list. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the DesignerActionItem class. 

            Public Overrides Function GetSortedActionItems() _
        As DesignerActionItemCollection
            Dim items As New DesignerActionItemCollection()

            'Define static section header entries.
            items.Add(New DesignerActionHeaderItem("Appearance"))
            items.Add(New DesignerActionHeaderItem("Information"))

            'Boolean property for locking color selections.
            items.Add(New DesignerActionPropertyItem( _
            "LockColors", _
            "Lock Colors", _
            "Appearance", _
            "Locks the color properties."))

            If Not LockColors Then
                items.Add( _
                New DesignerActionPropertyItem( _
                "BackColor", _
                "Back Color", _
                "Appearance", _
                "Selects the background color."))

                items.Add( _
                New DesignerActionPropertyItem( _
                "ForeColor", _
                "Fore Color", _
                "Appearance", _
                "Selects the foreground color."))

                'This next method item is also added to the context menu 
                ' (as a designer verb).
                items.Add( _
                New DesignerActionMethodItem( _
                Me, _
                "InvertColors", _
                "Invert Colors", _
                "Appearance", _
                "Inverts the fore and background colors.", _
                True))
            End If
            items.Add( _
            New DesignerActionPropertyItem( _
            "Text", _
            "Text String", _
            "Appearance", _
            "Sets the display text."))

            'Create entries for static Information section.
            Dim location As New StringBuilder("Location: ")
            location.Append(colLabel.Location)
            Dim size As New StringBuilder("Size: ")
            size.Append(colLabel.Size)

            items.Add( _
            New DesignerActionTextItem( _
            location.ToString(), _
            "Information"))

            items.Add( _
            New DesignerActionTextItem( _
            size.ToString(), _
            "Information"))

            Return items
        End Function

        public override DesignerActionItemCollection GetSortedActionItems()
    {
        DesignerActionItemCollection items = new DesignerActionItemCollection();

        //Define static section header entries.
        items.Add(new DesignerActionHeaderItem("Appearance"));
        items.Add(new DesignerActionHeaderItem("Information"));

        //Boolean property for locking color selections.
        items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("LockColors",
                         "Lock Colors", "Appearance",
                         "Locks the color properties."));
        if (!LockColors)
        {
            items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("BackColor",
                             "Back Color", "Appearance",
                             "Selects the background color."));
            items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("ForeColor",
                             "Fore Color", "Appearance",
                             "Selects the foreground color."));

            //This next method item is also added to the context menu 
            // (as a designer verb).
            items.Add(new DesignerActionMethodItem(this,
                             "InvertColors", "Invert Colors",
                             "Appearance",
                             "Inverts the fore and background colors.",
                              true));
        }
        items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("Text",
                         "Text String", "Appearance",
                         "Sets the display text."));

        //Create entries for static Information section.
        StringBuilder location = new StringBuilder("Location: ");
        location.Append(colLabel.Location);
        StringBuilder size = new StringBuilder("Size: ");
        size.Append(colLabel.Size);
        items.Add(new DesignerActionTextItem(location.ToString(),
                         "Information"));
        items.Add(new DesignerActionTextItem(size.ToString(),
                         "Information"));

        return items;
    }

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to create a DesignerActionItemCollection and populate it to form a smart tag list. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the DesignerActionItem class.

            "Appearance", _

            'Create entries for static Information section.

        public override DesignerActionItemCollection GetSortedActionItems()
    {
        DesignerActionItemCollection items = new DesignerActionItemCollection();

        //Define static section header entries.
        items.Add(new DesignerActionHeaderItem("Appearance"));
        items.Add(new DesignerActionHeaderItem("Information"));

        //Boolean property for locking color selections.
        items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("LockColors",
                         "Lock Colors", "Appearance",
                         "Locks the color properties."));
        if (!LockColors)
        {
            items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("BackColor",
                             "Back Color", "Appearance",
                             "Selects the background color."));
            items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("ForeColor",
                             "Fore Color", "Appearance",
                             "Selects the foreground color."));

            //This next method item is also added to the context menu 
            // (as a designer verb).
            items.Add(new DesignerActionMethodItem(this,
                             "InvertColors", "Invert Colors",
                             "Appearance",
                             "Inverts the fore and background colors.",
                              true));
        }
        items.Add(new DesignerActionPropertyItem("Text",
                         "Text String", "Appearance",
                         "Sets the display text."));

        //Create entries for static Information section.
        StringBuilder location = new StringBuilder("Location: ");
        location.Append(colLabel.Location);
        StringBuilder size = new StringBuilder("Size: ");
        size.Append(colLabel.Size);
        items.Add(new DesignerActionTextItem(location.ToString(),
                         "Information"));
        items.Add(new DesignerActionTextItem(size.ToString(),
                         "Information"));

        return items;
    }
  • Contains(DesignerActionItem)

    Determines whether the DesignerActionItemCollection contains a specific element.

    public bool Contains (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DesignerActionItem

      The DesignerActionItem to locate in the DesignerActionItemCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the DesignerActionItemCollection contains the specified value; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(DesignerActionItem[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the current collection into the supplied array, starting at the specified array index.

    public void CopyTo (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DesignerActionItem[]

      The one-dimensional DesignerActionItem array that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

  • IndexOf(DesignerActionItem)

    Determines the index of a specific item in the collection.

    public int IndexOf (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DesignerActionItem

      The DesignerActionItem to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire DesignerActionItemCollection, if found; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,DesignerActionItem)

    Inserts an element into the DesignerActionItemCollection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.

    • value
      DesignerActionItem

      The DesignerActionItem to insert.

  • Remove(DesignerActionItem)

    Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the DesignerActionItemCollection.

    public void Remove (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem value);

    Parameters

    • value
      DesignerActionItem

      The DesignerActionItem to remove from the DesignerActionItemCollection.
